column5: I think earlier in the year I made a post about catching my new PB pike at 47.5 inches.  It broke my previous record of 47 inches.  Well it turns out that it was the same fish I had caught 2 years prior.  Here's a cool video of the experience showcasing the importance of catch and release.  I still made some handling errors, my net is too small etc.  But doing your best to preserve the life of trophy fish goes a long way, and you CAN catch that fish again!!! Enjoy.
Well done bud.  Is it norm to only gain 1/2 inch in 2 years? Guess like humans, we just grow out not up.LOL  Grats dude.

Well done bud.  Is it norm to only gain 1/2 inch in 2 years? Guess like humans, we just grow out not up.LOL  Grats dude. I have no science on the matter. I would imagine that early in their lives, they grow much faster until they reach a MAX point of some sort.  Either way, 1/2 inch in 2 years shows how fragile a population of large fish could be, and emphasizes the need for catch and release of trophy fish.
Cool! I wonder how much food supply affects their growth in length? it seems to make them thicker?
Nice video and great recatch steve!!!
